snippet: The move toward embracing deeper capital markets shows a sentiment in financial circles that regulators and policy makers should shift their focus to encouraging market growth.
abstract: European Commission proposes plan to streamline rules for financial markets that will make it easier for start-up companies to raise funds from sources other than banks, with goal of encouraging Britain to see European Union as economic opportunity.

byline.original: By JAMES KANTER and JENNY ANDERSON
byline.contributor: James Kanter reported from Brussels and Jenny Anderson from London.

lead_paragraph: The move toward embracing deeper capital markets shows a sentiment in financial circles that regulators and policy makers should shift their focus to encouraging market growth.

headline.main: Europe Proposes a Capital Markets Union
headline.print_headline: In Europe, a Proposal to Innovate in Markets
